defi.title: Crypto Wallet Android App
defi.description: Non-custodial mobile wallet with multi-chain support, real-time portfolio tracking, and secure transaction signing.

caseStudy.title: Case Study
caseStudy.problem: The fragmented DeFi landscape forces users to juggle multiple wallets, manually track assets across chains, and navigate complex interfaces with poor mobile UX. Security concerns around private key management, phishing attacks, and transaction simulation failures create friction and risk. Users need a unified, mobile-first solution that simplifies multi-chain asset management while maintaining security and transparency.

problemSection.title: Problem
problemSection.description: Mobile DeFi users faced critical challenges:
items: Fragmented wallet experience across multiple chains and protocols
Poor mobile UX with desktop-first interfaces ported to mobile
Lack of real-time portfolio visibility and transaction history
Security risks from inadequate transaction simulation and approval flows
Complex private key management without compromising self-custody
Limited support for emerging chains and token standards

solutionSection.title: Solution
solutionSection.description: A mobile-native, non-custodial wallet designed for the multi-chain DeFi ecosystem:
items: Unified interface for managing assets across Ethereum, Polygon, Arbitrum, and other EVM chains
Secure enclave-based private key storage with biometric authentication
Real-time portfolio tracking with token prices, balances, and transaction history
Transaction simulation and approval flow with clear risk indicators
Native support for DeFi protocols: swaps, staking, lending, and NFTs

items.text: Secure Enclave key management with biometric unlock and transaction signing
Multi-chain portfolio dashboard with real-time price feeds and balance tracking
Transaction simulation before signing to prevent failed or malicious transactions
Optimized gas estimation with dynamic fee adjustment for faster confirmations
Comprehensive transaction history with categorization and tax reporting support
Native DeFi integrations: DEX aggregation, staking, lending, and NFT management

neural.title: Restaurant Delivery iOS App
neural.description: Cloud-native delivery platform with real-time coordination, smart dispatch, and deterministic order state management.

caseStudy.title: Case Study
caseStudy.problem: Modern food delivery platforms operate under constant pressure: unpredictable demand, strict time constraints, and real-world dependencies that don't fail gracefully. A single order touches multiple actors—customer, restaurant, courier, payment systems—where any delay or inconsistency compounds into poor delivery times and lost trust. At scale, coordinating these moving parts becomes a distributed systems problem, not just a marketplace.

problemSection.title: Problem
items: Non-deterministic order flows - Orders changing state inconsistently across clients
Race conditions between preparation, dispatch, and pickup
Dispatch inefficiencies - Suboptimal courier assignment under real-world constraints
Poor handling of sudden demand spikes
Limited system resilience - Tight coupling between services amplifying failures
Slow recovery from partial outages
Scaling bottlenecks - Architecture not designed for city-level or regional expansion
Increasing latency as order volume grew

solutionSection.title: Solution
solutionSection.description: Built a cloud-native delivery platform optimized for real-time coordination and scale:
items: Modeled the delivery flow as a state-driven, event-based system
Decoupled order management, dispatch, and tracking into independently scalable services
Introduced real-time synchronization across all actors
Designed infrastructure to scale horizontally without impacting latency or reliability

items.text: Deterministic Order State Engine - Predictable transitions from order creation to completion, reduced failures caused by concurrent updates
Smart Dispatch Layer - Context-aware courier assignment, dynamic ETA and routing recalculation
Operational Visibility - Live insight into order flow, delays, and failure points
Built to handle peak demand without degradation

saas.title: AI Social Media Management Terminal App
saas.description: Enterprise-grade automation platform for orchestrating high-volume social media and email campaigns across multiple providers.

caseStudy.title: Case Study
caseStudy.problem: Fragmented automation workflows across disconnected tools and providers. Limited visibility into campaign execution, message queues, and delivery failures. Provider rate limits, API instability, and silent failures causing unpredictable outcomes. Lack of centralized observability and auditability for automated outbound activity. Difficulty scaling campaigns while maintaining reliability, compliance, and control.

problemSection.title: Problem
items: Fragmented automation workflows across disconnected tools and providers
Limited visibility into campaign execution, message queues, and delivery failures
Provider rate limits, API instability, and silent failures causing unpredictable outcomes
Lack of centralized observability and auditability for automated outbound activity
Difficulty scaling campaigns while maintaining reliability, compliance, and control

solutionSection.title: Solution
solutionSection.description: A unified automation platform designed for operational control:
items: Centralized orchestration of email and social automation pipelines with deterministic execution
Real-time monitoring of job execution, queues, and provider health
Built-in failure handling with retries, backoff strategies, and error classification
Operator-focused interface enabling fast diagnosis and operational control

items.text: Campaign pipeline orchestration with scheduled and event-driven execution
High-throughput message queue with backpressure and rate-limit awareness
Multi-provider abstraction layer for email and social platforms
Real-time delivery metrics and historical performance tracking
Structured error logging, retries, and dead-letter queues
Audit trail for all automation actions and configuration changes
Role-based access control and environment separation (prod / staging / dry-run)
